item.title: Deploy Azure Kubernetes Service with NAT Gateway using Terraform
item.description: • Azure NAT Gateway is a fully managed highly resilient NAT (Network Address Translation) service provided by Microsoft. After creating a NAT Gateway and then associating it with a subnet, all devices in that subnet will automatically route outbound traffic through the gateway. This is because NAT Gateway takes precedence over other outbound routing methods and replaces the default Internet destination of a subnet. However, the presence of custom UDRs for virtual appliances and ExpressRoute override NAT gateway for directing internet bound traffic (route to the 0.0.0.0/0 address prefix).
